metadata.title: CVE-2018-6101 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A lack of host validation in DevTools in Google Chrome prior to66.0.3359.117 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via acrafted HTML page, if the user is running a remote DevTools debuggingserver.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6101` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
chromium-browser-l10n - 66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
chromium-chromedriver - 66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0.3359.139-0ubuntu0.18.04.3').
